dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey everyone, welcome back to the 'Future-Proof Your Life' podcast. So, uh, I stumbled upon this article earlier, and it's... it's quite something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh? What's got you all giggly this morning, A?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh? What's got you all giggly this morning, A?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's titled something like, 'Five Ways to Totally Tank Your Career Prospects.' And it literally gives advice on how to, like, ruin your career within a decade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's titled something like, Five Ways to Totally Tank Your Career Prospects. And it literally gives advice on how to, like, ruin your career within a decade.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Well, here are five things Id recommend to all students interested in future-proofing their career.

dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Wait, seriously? Who writes that stuff? Is it supposed to be reverse psychology or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, seriously? Who writes that stuff? Is it supposed to be reverse psychology or something?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, the first one, B, it says: 'Project management skills are useless.' It claims they're a relic, uh, and that companies are now built around random chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, the first one, B, it says: Project management skills are useless. It claims they're a relic, uh, and that companies are now built around random chaos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Project management skills are transferable across many fields Every field and every profession has its own set of very specific and narrowly defined essential skills. At the same time, some skills are universal and applicable in many fields. One such skill is project management.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Random chaos? Uh, I don't know about you, but every single job I've ever had, project management was like, *critical* for, you know, getting things done.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Random chaos? Uh, I don't know about you, but every single job I've ever had, project management was like, critical for, you know, getting things done.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? They even quote, 'Expect the best, plan for the worst,' and then say this should make you weep! Like, no, that's literally what you *should* be doing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? They even quote, Expect the best, plan for the worst, and then say this should make you weep! Like, no, that's literally what you should be doing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An unofficial motto of project managers is wisely expressed by American entrepreneur Denis Waitley: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised. The quote may make you smile, but it also conveys how solid project management skills will stand you in good stead, in practically any profession.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. If you want to, uh, actually succeed, you need those skills. Otherwise, good luck making deadlines, I guess?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. If you want to, uh, actually succeed, you need those skills. Otherwise, good luck making deadlines, I guess?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Moving on to number two, they advise 'Ignoring your projects' and say 'multitasking is the only thing that matters.' Like, just juggle everything at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moving on to number two, they advise Ignoring your projects and say multitasking is the only thing that matters. Like, just juggle everything at once.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The reality is that in the modern complex world multitasking is unavoidable and multitasking skills are highly valued. The challenge is to develop effective multitasking skills according to the personal intellectual and psychological abilities and planning skills, as effective planning and prioritizing are in the center of the modern school of multitasking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, I *hate* that advice! Every productivity guru out there says multitasking is a myth. You just do a bunch of things badly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I hate that advice! Every productivity guru out there says multitasking is a myth. You just do a bunch of things badly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they literally say 'avoid developing multitasking skills' but in a way that suggests you *should* avoid it to fail. It's so confusingly written if you don't catch the irony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they literally say avoid developing multitasking skills but in a way that suggests you should avoid it to fail. It's so confusingly written if you don't catch the irony.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The challenge is to develop effective multitasking skills according to the personal intellectual and psychological abilities and planning skills, as effective planning and prioritizing are in the center of the modern school of multitasking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, uh, pretty clear they're trying to trip you up. And then planning and prioritizing? They say to completely reject those too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, uh, pretty clear they're trying to trip you up. And then planning and prioritizing? They say to completely reject those too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...as effective planning and prioritizing are in the center of the modern school of multitasking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, like, the opposite of what any successful person does, right? You need to plan!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, like, the opposite of what any successful person does, right? You need to plan!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And number three... 'Forget about any semblance of communication skills.' They claim modern communication has 'no rules, techniques.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And number three... Forget about any semblance of communication skills. They claim modern communication has no rules, techniques.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the rapidly globalizing world, strong communication skills have become increasingly important for staying competitive in the job market today and tomorrow. Although almost everyone can claim to have communication skills in one form or another, modern effective communication has its own rules, techniques and scientific principles which can significantly boost success in communication.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: And that, uh, bad communication will significantly *damage* your success. Which, I mean, is true! But they're telling you to *not* communicate effectively.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that, uh, bad communication will significantly damage your success. Which, I mean, is true! But they're telling you to not communicate effectively.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the rapidly globalizing world, strong communication skills have become increasingly important for staying competitive in the job market today and tomorrow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, if you want to be unemployable, just, uh, never explain anything, ever. Keep all your brilliant ideas to yourself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, if you want to be unemployable, just, uh, never explain anything, ever. Keep all your brilliant ideas to yourself.

dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. And then, uh, this one made me laugh: 'Outdated digital skills are key.' They're advising people to avoid new tech like AI and social media.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. And then, uh, this one made me laugh: Outdated digital skills are key. They're advising people to avoid new tech like A I and social media.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Advanced digital skills have become increasingly important as we use and rely on our new technologies social media, various gadgets and artificial intelligence.

dialogue_turns.text: What?! [chuckles] In *this* economy? Like, being able to use Microsoft Office badly is a skill now? I mean, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What?! In this economy? Like, being able to use Microsoft Office badly is a skill now? I mean, come on.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they say employers demand recent grads be 'incapable of anything' from using the internet to coding. It's, like, a recipe for guaranteed unemployment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they say employers demand recent grads be incapable of anything from using the internet to coding. It's, like, a recipe for guaranteed unemployment.

dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And the last one, A, 'Emotional intelligence can be easily replaced by technology.' They define it as an 'inability to deal effectively with emotions.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And the last one, A, Emotional intelligence can be easily replaced by technology. They define it as an inability to deal effectively with emotions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Emotional intelligence cant be easily replaced by technology... In a nutshell, emotional intelligence is your ability to deal effectively with emotions, create appropriate emotional relations with each other, communicate competently with workplace teams, and intelligently and appropriately use emotional information to create a positive workplace environment.

dialogue_turns.text: Which is, uh, the complete opposite of what emotional intelligence *actually* is! It's about empathy, understanding, building good relationships.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, uh, the complete opposite of what emotional intelligence actually is! It's about empathy, understanding, building good relationships.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, if you want to create a toxic workplace and fail at your job, then, yeah, avoid emotional intelligence. But for everyone else, uh, lean into it!

dialogue_turns.text: Seriously. So, listeners, if you want to, like, *actually* succeed, just take all five of these points and do the absolute opposite of what the article ironically suggests.
